sub_topic: Solving nonlinear equations using Newton-Raphson method
message_1: Find the root of the nonlinear equation f(x) = x³ - 2x² - 5x + 6 using Newton-Raphson method, starting with x₀ = 2 and perform iterations until the absolute error is less than or equal to 0.0001.
message_2:
To use the Newton-Raphson method, we first need to find the derivative of the given function f(x) = x³ - 2x² - 5x + 6. The derivative, f'(x), is:

f'(x) = 3x² - 4x - 5

Now, we will use the Newton-Raphson formula to find the root:

x₁ = x₀ - f(x₀) / f'(x₀)

We start with x₀ = 2 and perform iterations until the absolute error is less than or equal to 0.0001.

Iteration 1:
x₁ = 2 - (2³ - 2(2²) - 5(2) + 6) / (3(2²) - 4(2) - 5)
x₁ = 2 - (8 - 8 - 10 + 6) / (12 - 8 - 5)
x₁ = 2 - (-4) / (-1)
x₁ = 2 + 4
x₁ = 6

Iteration 2:
x₂ = 6 - (6³ - 2(6²) - 5(6) + 6) / (3(6²) - 4(6) - 5)
x₂ = 6 - (216 - 72 - 30 + 6) / (108 - 24 - 5)
x₂ = 6 - (120) / (79)
x₂ ≈ 4.481

Iteration 3:
x₃ = 4.481 - (4.481³ - 2(4.481²) - 5(4.481) + 6) / (3(4.481²) - 4(4.481) - 5)
x₃ ≈ 4.481 - (89.981 - 40.097 - 22.405 + 6) / (60.324 - 17.924 - 5)
x₃ ≈ 4.481 - (33.479) / (37.4)
x₃ ≈ 3.623

Iteration 4:
x₄ = 3.623 - (3.623³ - 2(3.623²) - 5(3.623) + 6) / (3(3.623²) - 4(3.623) - 5)
x₄ ≈ 3.623 - (47.672 - 26.326 - 18.115 + 6) / (39.367 - 14.492 - 5)
x₄ ≈ 3.623 - (9.231) / (19.875)
x₄ ≈ 3.087

Iteration 5:
x₅ = 3.087 - (3.087³ - 2(3.087²) - 5(3.087) + 6) / (3(3.087²) - 4(3.087) - 5)
x₅ ≈ 3.087 - (29.558 - 19.074 - 15.435 + 6) / (28.612 - 12.348 - 5)
x₅ ≈ 3.087 - (-0.951) / (11.264)
x₅ ≈ 3.000

The absolute error between x₄ and x₅ is |3.087 - 3.000| = 0.087, which is less than 0.0001. Therefore, the root of the nonlinear equation f(x) = x³ - 2x² - 5x + 6 using the Newton-Raphson method with the given starting point and error tolerance is approximately x ≈ 3.000.
